H0.text: Energy is what ecosystems absorb on the earth.

H1.text: Water is absorbed by ecosystems on Earth.

H2.text: Hydrogen is absorbed by ecosystems on Earth.

H3.text: Fuel is absorbed by ecosystems on Earth.

A4.text: Energy and carbon enter ecosystems through photosynthesis

A5.text: As water moves through dead organic matter, it dissolves and carries with it the water-soluble components.

A6.text: The average rate of energy captured by global photosynthesis is approximately 130 terawatts, which is about eight times the total power consumption of human civilization.

A7.text: Photosynthetic organisms also convert around 100â€“115 billion tons of carbon into biomass per year.
